disc:
Intranasal foreign bodies are common in children but they are usually asymptomatic. They are commonly located on the floor of the nasal passage. Common symptoms include
- Mucopurulent discharge
- Ddour
- Epistaxis
- Nasal obstruction
- Mouth breathing

Atrophic rhinitis is usually accompanied by nasal itching, sneezing, rhinorrhoea, and nasal congestion.

Enlarged adenoids are the most common cause of nasal obstruction in a child. In addition, they also have mouth breathing, mucopurulent nasal discharge, snoring and disturbed sleep.

Acquired deviation of the nasal septum is usually due to minor blunt trauma, sports, accidents, and other traumatic events.
